intro: Prismatomeris euphlebia, commonly known as the common moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces a distinctive, waxy fruit that contains numerous small, round seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it an intriguing subject for botanical study and ecological research.
